hints.Statics: Study of forces in equilibrium, analyzing structures, and calculating force reactions.
hints.Dynamics: Study of motion and forces in systems, including kinematics and kinetics.
hints.Mechanics of Materials: Analysis of stress, strain, and deformation in materials under load.
hints.Thermodynamics: Study of energy, heat, and work, as well as the behavior of systems at various temperatures.
hints.Fluid Mechanics: Analysis of fluid behavior and forces in static and moving fluids.
hints.Heat Transfer: Study of how heat moves between systems and the principles of conduction, convection, and radiation.
hints.Machine Design: Design and analysis of mechanical components and systems, including stress analysis, materials selection, and manufacturing considerations.
hints.Control Systems: Study of systems that regulate, command, or control the behavior of other systems, using feedback loops and controllers.
hints.Mechanical Vibrations: Analysis of oscillatory motion in mechanical systems, including natural frequencies, damping, and resonance.
hints.Materials Science: Study of the properties, behavior, and applications of engineering materials, such as metals, polymers, ceramics, and composites.
hints.Engineering Drawing: Techniques for creating technical drawings and blueprints to communicate design intent and manufacturing requirements.
hints.Manufacturing Processes: Study of various manufacturing methods, such as machining, casting, welding, and additive manufacturing.
hints.Mechatronics: Integration of mechanical, electrical, and computer engineering principles to design and control complex systems.
hints.Robotics: Design, analysis, and control of robots and automated systems for various applications.
hints.Automotive Engineering: Design and development of vehicles, including engines, drivetrains, suspension, and safety systems.
